result.execSummary:
The defendant Otoniel Herrera Ortiz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges granted.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

charges.descr: Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs)

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 3:52 PM: Defendant Otoniel Herrera Ortiz in court with attorney William Michael Lennon.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Oath administered at previous hearing today.   ADA recites terms of agreement with argued terms on sentencing.  Atty Lennon and Def confirm State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  GP  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Argument by ADA.  Argument by Atty Lennon.  States Def intends to move to the State of Washington where he believes he can obtain a valid DL.  Statement by Def:  None offered. The Court: Wil not take any action based upon what is happening in Marquette Co.  Accepts State's recomendation and orders 5 days WCJ, Court Costs - 60 DTP balance or PP, Report 4/1/2016 at 8:00 PM.    DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.  Hispanic Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Otoniel Herrera Ortiz in court with attorney William Michael Lennon. Atty Lennon appears telephonically. Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Lennon is requesting a motion hearing challenging the stop.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

Case Recalled @ 3:35 PM: Defendant Otoniel Herrera Ortiz in court - Defendant appears late.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Oath administered at previous hearing today.  Defendant states he needs more time to retain counsel.  Court suggests Defendant may wish to speak with the DA on his own regarding resolution.  Off Record for Def to speak directly with the ADA.  Back of Record @ 4:02: pm:    Per ADA:  Eligibility process was completed with SPD prior to going back of record.  Adjournment requested due to eligibility being confirmed.  STC scheduled  - NOH Given.  Defendant will not need to be present for the STC scheduled, provided counsel appears on his behalf.  Status conference scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Case Called @ 3:09 PM: Defendant Otoniel Herrera Ortiz not in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Enrique Soria present as Interpreter.  Oath administered at previous hearing today.   In light of nonappearance, Bench Warrant authorized with Statewide Extradition.  Court also orders forfeiture of $200 cash bond previously posted.
No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.

Case called @ 2:53 p.m. Defendant Otoniel Herrera Ortiz in court. Enrique Soria present to interpret.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be privately retaining counsel.  NGP entered.  Court orders $200 Cash Bond. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
